missionProperties.startingObjective: Find and free the captive. Optional: Find the Data Center and stop the transmission before the end of Round 4.
missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to open it.
{-} A terminal in the Data Center will transmit sensitive data at the end of Round 4. A Rebel figure can attack the terminal (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to destroy it.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Cell opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

changeRepositionOverride.theText: Block access to the doors and the terminal.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
"He's alive, for now." The transmission from Command came through regarding the operative captured a few days earlier. "He's going to be held for a couple of days in a facility near Thyferra before they transfer him to Coruscant."

You're also told that he was carrying a sensitive data packet that included positioning of Rebel operatives throughout the galaxy, including yourselves. Heavily encrypted, of course, but only a matter of time to crack it with the resources at the Empire's disposal.

You recall the final instructions of your commander as you crawl through cave networks and ventilation shafts. "Keeping that information out of the Empire's hands is very important, but the operative is your top priority."

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to open it.
{-} A terminal in the Data Center will transmit sensitive data at the end of Round 4. A Rebel figure can attack the terminal (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to destroy it.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Cell opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
After a few days of medical attention, the operative is finally coherent enough to talk. He quickly redirects you to a safe house where he hid stolen schematics for the new Imperial weapon, which you deliver to High Command for analysis.

Analysis of Weiss's weapon reveals it to be a smaller-scale version of the devastating Death Star superlaser. This new version is designed for fleet superiority instead of planetary destruction. "From all appearances, they could be mass-produced and fitted to  capital ships," your commander tells you, a grim tone in her voice.

She makes it clear that the Rebel fleet would have no answer to this firepower. "It might be that we could develop it ourselves, but our engineers can't seem to figure out a few of the last pieces. We think the plans must be old, or incomplete."

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Place Story Mission card "Incoming" into play.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
Returning to High Command empty-handed, you try not to think about the fate of the operative you left behind.

Fortunately, the operative managed to deliver stolen weapons schematics to a safe house, discovered by Rebel forces shortly after your rescue attempt.

Analysis of Weiss's weapon reveals it to be a smaller-scale version of the devastating Death Star superlaser. This new version is designed for fleet superiority instead of planetary destruction. "From all appearances, they could be mass-produced and fitted to  capital ships," your commander tells you, a grim tone in her voice.

She makes it clear that the Rebel fleet would have no answer to this firepower. "it might be that we could develop it ourselves, but our engineers can't seem to figure out a few of the last pieces. We think the plans must be old, or incomplete."

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Place Story Mission card "Drawn In" into play.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to open it.
{-} The mission will progress when the door to the Cell opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to open it.
{-} A terminal in the Data Center will transmit sensitive data at the end of Round 4. A Rebel figure can attack the terminal (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to destroy it.
{-} The mission token represents the captive. The captive is a Rebel figure (Health: 8, Speed: 2, Defense: 1 white die). Heroes control the captive as an ally.
{-} When the captive is targeted for an attack while adjacent to a hero who could also be a target of that attack, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to become the target of the attack.
{-} The red Rebel mission token represents the exit. The captive can escape through the exit.
{-} When the captive is defeated, select the exit and click "captive defeated".
{-} The Rebels win when the captive escapes.
{-} The Rebels lose when the captive is defeated or all heroes are wounded.
Help the captive escape. Optional: Find the Data Center and stop the transmission before the end of Round 4.

{-} The mission token represents the captive. The captive is a Rebel figure (Health: 8, Speed: 2, Defense: 1 white die). Heroes control the captive as an ally.
{-} When the captive is targeted for an attack while adjacent to a hero who could also be a target of that attack, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to become the target of the attack.
{-} The red Rebel mission token represents the exit. The captive can escape through the exit.
{-} When the captive is defeated, select the exit and click "captive defeated".
{-} The Rebels win when the captive escapes.
{-} The Rebels lose when the captive is defeated or all heroes are wounded.
"Will someone remove this Rebel scum from my facility?" The voice comes through the comm system. "Don't just stand there, you fools, get them!"

Out of the holding cell stumbles a bloody and battered man, clutching his side.

{-} Place 1 Rebel mission token on the green highlighted space.
{-} The mission token represents the captive. The captive is a Rebel figure (Health: 8, Speed: 2, Defense: 1 white die). Heroes control the captive as an ally.
{-} When the captive is targeted for an attack while adjacent to a hero who could also be a target of that attack, that hero may suffer 1 {C} to become the target of the attack.

entityProperties.name: Exit
entityProperties.theText:
The hatch leads into the air vents, and to freedom.

{-} The captive can escape through the exit.
{-} When the captive is defeated, select the exit and click "captive defeated".

entityProperties.name: Cell Door
entityProperties.theText:
The door in the sparely lighted corridor looks sturdy.

{-} Doors are locked. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to open it.

globalEvents.name: Transmission Received
globalEvents.eventText: "Excellent," a voice says though the facility's communication system. "The data transfer is complete. The prisoner is no longer necessary. Please dispose of him."

entityProperties.theText:

globalEvents.name: The Prisoner-1
globalEvents.eventText:
After a few steps, the captive winces as blood pours through the fingers clutched to his side.

{-} The captive becomes <color="red">Bleeding</color>.

globalEvents.name: The Prisoner-2
globalEvents.eventText: Alarms blare through the facility, calling in more reinforcements.

eventActions.theText:
You try to slice the terminal's security systems.

{-} Test {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal.

inputList.theText:
You make progress, but the security protocols are too tight. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token for each {B} result on the terminal.

{-} Test {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

globalEvents.name: The Data
globalEvents.eventText:
You smash the data center, scattering the sensitive electronics across the room in several ruined pieces. When you're finished, nothing is left in the room but smoldering wreckage.

Whatever secrets were stolen, they're safe from the Empire now. All that remains is to escape with the operative.

{-} The heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

entityProperties.name: Transmission Terminal
entityProperties.theText:
The terminal hums softly as it transmits the Rebel data.

{-} The terminal will transmit sensitive data at the end of Round 4. A Rebel figure can attack the terminal (Health: 6, Defense: 1 black die) or interact ({I}) to destroy it.

globalEvents.name: End Mission Terminal Not Destroyed
globalEvents.eventText: Because the heroes did not destroy the terminal in the Data Center, the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) increases by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
